page.title: 03DUNKERTON LIFE
page.content: In the main the people of Dunkerton go outside the village for recreational activies. The former primary school is however used as a village hall for various activities such as bingo evenings. There is a branch of the Womens Institute and the village has a thriving cricket club with a team playing regularly on a well tended pitch. The Church of England parish church is not very active and does not play a major part in village life. The parish shares a vicar with the neighbouring parishes of Camerton and Shoscombe. A service is held each Sunday but the congregation is only around six. The nearby hamlet of Withyditch has a Baptist chapel which is rather more active, but Withyditch is a separate community with little involvement in Dunkerton.
